intro: Brassaiopsis glomerulata var. rufostellata, commonly known as the red-stemmed hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range from pink to deep red. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with woody stems and broad, ovate leaves. Its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences and bloom during the summer months. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
